descriptive_name: Polymer of 4,4'-isopropylidenediphenol and 1-chloro-2,3-epoxypropane (liquid); Bisphenol A type epoxy resin (liquid)

acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since a potential that relevant toxicity was indicated in the water solubility (0.041mg/L(CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version) (2006) and others)) of this substance could not be denied from 48 hours EC50=1.7mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version) (2006) and others), it was classified into Category 1.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: No definitive value available, although the substance can be classified as Category 4 or above, based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of >1,600mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-36 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" (20degC, 1atm) according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 11,400mg/kg representing the lowest fixed value of the testing data, >1,000mg/kg, 11,400mg/kg, and 13,600mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-36 (2002)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of existing classification.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF<=42(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), and somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests and chromosome aberration tests), described in DFGOT vol. 19 (2003).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on reproductive toxicity and teratogenicity tests (PATTY (4th, 2000), DFGOT vol.19 (2003)): No reproductive and developmental toxicity is observed at dosing levels toxic to parental animals.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing a distorted ring structure.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-36 (2002)): The substance does not cause or causes moderate irritation to the eyes. The substance is considered "mildly irritating."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit primary skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-36 (2002), DFGOT vol.19 (2003)): The substance does not cause or causes moderate irritation to the skin, though the results of 4-hour application are not available. The substance is considered "irritating."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the report on human cases and tests on human volunteers (CERI Hazard Data 2001-36 (2002), DFGOT vol.19 (2003), the results of guinea pig skin sensitization tests and the classification by the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy (category: skin sensitizing substance). The substance causes skin sensitization.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
